column4: Hi, .. I'm running 10.10 x64. I'm having issues getting ub to recognize my network card (mobo nic). Any suggestions? lshal > shows my nic though?
is it listed under iwconfig?
: Nope
does anything come up from $ lsmod | grep rtl
: Nope
can you pastebin the output of your lshw -C network?
: is there something specific in that command output your looking for?.. It's on another box i'm sitting next too.
the driver for the NIC
something like driver=BLAH
:  it just gives the output being > description of the nic (realtek ..bus info.. size, ..serial.. clock speed) ..It doesn't actually mention anything about a driver
try    $ sudo rmmod r8187 && sudo modprobe r8168
then see if its listed under iwconfig
: should I be including the "$" infront of my command?
no
: ok 1 second
: The following error occured >>> Module r8187 does not exist in /proc/modules
: I'm assuming this means the driver isn't installed on the system.. However, I was working fine on this machine connected to the internet for the past 3 weeks.. today this problem just came up
Did you upgrade or change anything?
: Onlything I updated was the security package from the updater this morning. ..But it WAS working just fine after that.. \
are you dual booting?
: Nope
